definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
Chinese translation of "kung flu", a term used by US President Trump in 2020 to refer to COVID-19 as a "Chinese" disease
very concentrated type of tea drunk in Chaozhou, Fujian and Taiwan

If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
containing_words.word: 只要功夫深，铁杵磨成针

definition: to maximize one's time/to catch some time out/to find enough time/(also 抓工夫)

sentences.english: It is the ancestor of karate and ju-jitsu.
sentences.chinese: 功夫起源于中国，是空手道和柔术的祖先。

sentences.english: Kungfu martial artists learn the jump inside crescent kick in three different parts.
sentences.chinese: 学习功夫武术家内新月形踢三个不同的部分跳。

sentences.english: It takes work to tell a story succinctly.
sentences.chinese: 简洁地讲述一个故事是需要花功夫的。

sentences.english: It takes years to master a new subject.
sentences.chinese: 掌握一门新学科要花多年功夫。

sentences.english: So my kungfu might not be as good as… later on.
sentences.chinese: 所以我的功夫可能不像晚些那么好。

sentences.english: Song Hye - kyo is learning traditional Kongfu for her part in the Hwangjini.
sentences.chinese: 为了片中的角色，宋慧乔正在学习传统的中国功夫。

sentences.english: And have a chance for ourselves from beam wall be improved a lot later kungfu.
sentences.chinese: 并有机会师从梁壁令自己的咏春功夫得到很大提升。

sentences.english: Go on a “staycation” Even though summer is ending, your ability to relax should not.
sentences.chinese: 即使夏天快要结束了，但你休闲的功夫不能下降。

sentences.english: Well, you mentioned Kungfu, or boxing just now, I would say there are about 200 schools.
sentences.chinese: 你提到了功夫，或拳术，它们至少有200种门派。

sentences.english: Master Wang is the leader of the Hong Men, a group which is noted for its kungfu skills.
sentences.chinese: 王进发师傅是洪门的山主，该门派以其功夫技巧闻名。

sentences.english: Little Kung Fu, a bowl of noodles are eaten.
sentences.chinese: 不大功夫，一碗面就被吃光了。

sentences.english: Every year, how much do you roughly spend in Kungfu?
sentences.chinese: 您每年在真功夫消费大约多少钱？

sentences.english: With an effort, he was able to shut in whatever words he had been about to say.
sentences.chinese: 花了一番功夫，他才控制住没说出他准备说的话。

sentences.english: You have taken pains to show me how to do the work .
sentences.chinese: 你已经下了功夫教我如何干那工作。

sentences.english: Boy, it's marvelous. I prefer Neijia to Waijia. Well, who's the forefather of Neijia then?
sentences.chinese: 哇，内家功夫真是神了，我喜欢。谁是它的开山鼻祖？

sentences.english: Yes. I have only been in town for four days now.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我到本市来才不过几天的功夫。

definition: training in the basic skills/knowledge of the fundamentals
flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to put in time and energy/to concentrate one's efforts
